ygData.subject: new Windows binary installer
ygData.msgSnippet: I have just put on the sourceforge site a new windows binary installer for Cantera (Cantera160r1.msi). It is smaller than the previous installers, since I

I have just put on the sourceforge site a new windows binary installer 
for Cantera (Cantera160r1.msi).

It is smaller than the previous installers, since I removed the static 
libraries that are needed only for building C++ or Fortran 
applications. If you are writing C++/Fortran code, you should be 
compiling Cantera from the source anyway, so it seems there is no point 
in putting these .lib files in the binary installer, and it 
significantly reduces the size of the installer (from ~6 Mb to ~1 Mb).

Mostly this release contains only minor changes. But I recommend that 
you upgrade anyway (if you are installing Cantera from the .msi file 
and not building it yourself from source code), particularly if you are 
using Cantera from MATLAB.

New features:

- support for non-integral reactant and product stoichiometric 
coefficients for irreversible reactions.

- ck2cti now can parse Chemkin-format reaction mechanisms that contain 
the extensions used in the MIT soot mechanism to specify very large 
molecules in the THERMO section records.


Bug fix:

- A minor bug has been fixed that suppressed Cantera diagnostic 
messages during flame simulations from MATLAB under Windows.  Now you 
will see the progress of the calculation as it runs.


Known issues:

In the Python demos, the equilibrium example 'multiphase_plasma.cti' 
fails to converge at low temperature (350 K), although it works fine on 
Mac/linux platforms. If works if you set the initial temperature to 400 
K.

In the MATLAB demos, 'catcomb.m' reports 'time integration failed.'  
Again, this works fine on Mac/linux.

Probably both of these just need some fine tuning to run on Windows.  I 
believe all of the other demos run.


====================

Note to "Windows power users":
I have also updated CVS, and now you will find in the Cantera solution 
in Visual C++ a new project "SetupCanteraLite".  This builds an 
installer that skips packaging the static libraries.
